intro: Argostemma inaequale, commonly known as the unequal argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for horticultural purposes.
